What is a Clinical Trial Protocol?
What is a Clinical Trial Protocol?

Clinical Trial Study Start-Up and Initiation

Data Management, Source Documentation and Case Report Forms
Data Management, Source Documentation and Case Report Forms

Adverse Events, Safety Monitoring and Safety Reporting

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.url: story_content/external_files/Contingent Reimbursement, Startup, and Closeout Fees.pdf
resource.title: Contingent Reimbursement, Startup, and Closeout Fees

resource.url: story_content/external_files/Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE).pdf
resource.title: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE)

terms.term: Any untoward medical occurrence in a subject administered an investigational therapeutic and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this therapeutic.
Adverse Event; Any untoward medical occurrence in a subject administered an investigational product and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment.
Attributable, Legible, Contemporaneous, Original and Accurate. A standard for documentation.
Attributable, Legible, Contemporaneous, Original, Accurate and Complete. A standard for documentation in records and reports.

"Assent" is a term used to express willingness to participate in research by persons who are by definition too young to give informed consent but who are old enough to understand the proposed research in general, its expected risks and possible benefits, and the activities expected of them as subjects.

If an audit is conducted by a regulatory body, a sponsor, IRB, or third party, a certificate will be issued outlining that the audit was performed. Audit findings are not appended to this certificate.
A record of the changes that have been made to a database, file or source document.
Systematic prejudice in favor of, or against, one thing, person, or group compared with another, usually in a way considered to be unfair.
An expert in the statistical processes and methods applied to the collection, analysis, and interpretation of biological data and especially data relating to human biology, health, and medicine
Someone who does not know the treatment allocation of the subject
Blinding refers to the concealment of treatment allocation from one or more individuals (doctor, patient, sponsor etc) involved in a clinical research trial.

A case report form (or CRF) is a paper or electronic questionnaire used in clinical research. The Case Report Form is the tool used by the sponsor of the clinical trial to collect data from each participating site.

A confidentiality agreement, or CDA, is a document used by sponsors to ensure that any protocol, study or investigational information communication to an investigator or vendor remains confidential. Drug development is no stranger to corporate espionage and this the sponsors way of mitigating this. If you sign a CDA you are legally bound to not discuss the trial or IP outside of the parties listed on the CDA.

Central IRBs, also known as independent IRBs, are not affiliated with any particular institution and serve a wider group of researchers. Physicians conducting research at their private practice or at an institution which does not have an IRB, may utilize central IRBs for research review and approval.

Some trials will use a central lab to analyze samples. This will involve collecting the sample (i.e blood) and shipping to the study's lab for analysis. These results are then reported back as study data. Central labs help sponsors to ensure consistency across reported data.
Remote monitoring and data analytics

A copy of the original record that has been verified (ie by a dated signature or by a validated process) to have the same information, including that describe the context, content and structure, as the original.
The Charge Budget is what will be charged to the sponsor for your participation in the clinical trial. This budget includes your costs plus profit margins.

A Clinical Study Report (CSR) is a detailed document, prepared by the sponsor, detailing the methods and results of the trial. This document will address at minimum the safety and efficacy observations of the trial.
Refers to the amount of drug/therapeutic taken compared to the amount prescribed (2 pills per day taken vs. 3 pills per day prescribed.
Concomitant medication refers to any medication that the subject is taking in addition to the investigational product.

A confidentiality agreement, or CDA, is a document used by sponsors to ensure that any protocol, study or investigational information communication to an investigator or vendor remains confidential. Drug development is no stranger to corporate espionage and this the sponsors way of mitigating this. If you sign a CDA you are legally bound to not discuss the trial or IP outside of the parties listed on the CDA.
The IRB has a responsibility to conduct continuing reviews of each ongoing trial at intervals appropriate to the degree of risk to human subjects. This must occur, per GCP, at least once per year.

A contract research organization (CRO) is an organization that provides support to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries in the form of research services outsourced on a contract basis.
Clinical studies of a fixed sample size that do not use adaptive trial design elements.
The Cost Budget is the reflection of the costs that you and your institution/clinic will incur for running the clinical trial.
Clinical Research Associate. A sponsor representative tasked with monitoring the clinical trial.
Clinical Research Coordinator

A case report form (or CRF) is a paper or electronic questionnaire used in clinical research. The Case Report Form is the tool used by the sponsor of the clinical trial to collect data from each participating site.
A curriculum vitae (CV) is a written overview of a person's experience and other qualifications. Analogous to a "resume".
Trial data is analyzed as a conglomerate and compared against patient and site level data to identify outliers
Any information that may influence the behavior of the PI/Coordinator or the subject is withheld until after the test.
A data safety monitoring board (DSMB) â€” is an independent group of experts who monitor patient safety and treatment efficacy data while a clinical trial is ongoing.
The ability to produce a desired or intended result.
An eligible subject is one who meets all of the inclusion and exclusion criteria as outlined in the protocol.
Electronic Medical Records

Essential Documents are those documents which individually and collectively permit evaluation of the conduct of a trial and the quality of the data produced. These documents serve to demonstrate the compliance of the investigator, sponsor and monitor with the standards of Good Clinical Practice and with all applicable regulatory requirements.

"An Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Independent Ethics Committee (IEC) is a committee established to review and approve research involving human subjects.The primary function of these committees is to protect the rights, safety and well being of trial participants. All clinical research undertaken on human subjects must be reviewed and approved by an IRB per Good Clinical Practices (GCP). "

"An Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Independent Ethics Committee (IEC) is a committee established to review and approve research involving human subjects.The primary function of these committees is to protect the rights, safety and well being of trial participants. All clinical research undertaken on human subjects must be reviewed and approved by an IRB per Good Clinical Practices (GCP). "
Exclusion criteria are those characteristics that disqualify prospective subjects from inclusion in the study.
United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is charged with the approval of therapeutics to be marketed to the general public in the United States.
These clearly outlined the agreement reached between the sponsor and the investigator. The financial agreements may be buried within a Clinical Study Agreement (CSA)
Good Clinical Practice (GCP) is defined as a standard for the design, conduct, performance, monitoring, auditing, recording, analysis and reporting of clinical trials or studies

Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) is a system for ensuring that products are consistently produced and controlled according to quality standards. It is designed to minimize the risks involved in any pharmaceutical production that cannot be eliminated through testing the final product.
Good Clinical Practice (GCP) is defined as a standard for the design, conduct, performance, monitoring, auditing, recording, analysis and reporting of clinical trials or studies
The Investigator's Brochure (IB) is a comprehensive document summarizing the body of information about an investigational product ("IP" or "study drug") obtained during a drug trial.

The Informed Consent Form (ICF) is a paper, though occasionally electronic, document which document's a patient's consent to participate in a clinical trial. This document is specific to each clinical trial and is written in lay-language to a patient understand what they are consenting to. This document must be approved by a local ethics board prior to being presented to a patient. Typically the patient and a study staff member will sign.

"An Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Independent Ethics Committee (IEC) is a committee established to review and approve research involving human subjects.The primary function of these committees is to protect the rights, safety and well being of trial participants. All clinical research undertaken on human subjects must be reviewed and approved by an IRB per Good Clinical Practices (GCP). "
Inclusion criteria are characteristics that the prospective subjects must have if they are to be included in the study,

The Informed Consent Form (ICF) is a paper, though occasionally electronic, document which document's a patient's consent to participate in a clinical trial. This document is specific to each clinical trial and is written in lay-language to a patient understand what they are consenting to. This document must be approved by a local ethics board prior to being presented to a patient. Typically the patient and a study staff member will sign.
The insurance statement documents that compensation is available to subjects who experience trial related injury. This document is not a requirement in all ICH-GCP areas.
Investigation product refers to the therapeutic under study in the clinical trial. This is a non-approved drug or medical device.

The Investigator's Brochure (IB) is a comprehensive document summarizing the body of information about an investigational product ("IP" or "study drug") obtained during a drugs lifetime of development and research.

The Investigator Site File (ISF) is the compilation of documents which individually and collectively permit evaluation of the conduct of a clinical trial and the quality of the data produced at a site. These documents serve to demonstrate the compliance of the investigator, sponsor, and monitor with the standards of GCP and with all applicable regulatory requirements
Investigation product refers to the therapeutic under study in the clinical trial. This is a non-approved drug or medical device.

"An Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Independent Ethics Committee (IEC) is a committee established to review and approve research involving human subjects.The primary function of these committees is to protect the rights, safety and well being of trial participants. All clinical research undertaken on human subjects must be reviewed and approved by an IRB per Good Clinical Practices (GCP). "

The Investigator Site File (ISF) is the compilation of documents which individually and collectively permit evaluation of the conduct of a clinical trial and the quality of the data produced at a site. These documents serve to demonstrate the compliance of the investigator, sponsor, and monitor with the standards of GCP and with all applicable regulatory requirements

Some trials will use the site's local laboratory to analyze specimens. This could be the lab in your hospital who will analyze a blood sample for CBC and report back to you the results. These are then submitted in turn as study data.

The act of overseeing the progress of a clinical study, and of ensuring that it is conducted, recorded, and reported in accordance with the protocol, SOPs, GCP and applicable regulatory requirement(s).
A document that describes the strategy, methods, responsibilities and requirements for monitoring the trial.
Multi-center trials are those which are conducted at more than one hospital/clinic.
Non-Clinical studies refer to those conducted in animals and laboratory settings. Non-human testing.
A package insert is a document provided along with a prescription or over-the-counter medication to provide additional information about that drug.
The branch of pharmacology concerned with the effects of drugs and the mechanism of their action.
The branch of pharmacology concerned with the movement of drugs within the body.
Phlebotomy is the practice of drawing blood from patients

Principal Investigator (PI), or investigator, is the person who takes ultimate responsibility for the conduct of a clinical trial and the medical care of subjects enrolled in the particular research protocol at a clinical trial site. Qualified physician or dentist.
A harmless pill, medicine, or procedure prescribed more for the psychological benefit to the patient than for any physiological effect.
The Primary objective is the primary purpose for conducting the study. This is generally to evaluate either the safety or efficacy of the investigational product.

Principal Investigator (PI), or investigator, is the person who takes ultimate responsibility for the conduct of a clinical trial and the medical care of subjects enrolled in the particular research protocol at a clinical trial site. Qualified physician or dentist.

A clinical trial protocol is a comprehensive document prepared by the sponsor which outlines how the trial will be conducted. Including; background, purpose, investigational product, study procedures/assessments and timelines.
Any instance where the protocol procedures are not followed verbatim, is a protocol deviation. This must be reported to the sponsor and IRB.
Patient Recruitment Specialist

All of the planned and systemic actions that are established to ensure that the trial is performed and data are generated, documented (recorded), and reported in compliance with GCP and the applicable regulatory requirements.
The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial-related activities are fulfilled.

All of the planned and systemic actions that are established to ensure that the trial is performed and data are generated, documented (recorded), and reported in compliance with GCP and the applicable regulatory requirements
The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial-related activities are fulfilled.
The purpose of a query is to alert you to a data value and ask you to confirm whether or not it is correct.

In randomized controlled trials, the research participants are assigned by chance, rather than by choice, to either the experimental group or the control group. Randomization reduces bias as much as possible. Randomization is designed to "control" (reduce or eliminate if possible) bias by all means. Imagine flipping a coin, Treatment A vs Treatment B.
Subjects who are randomized into the clinical trial though are not treated with the investigation product per protocol.

Regulatory bodies or regulatory agencies are those which are tasked with the approval of therapeutics in a given jurisdiction. I. E Food and Drug Administration in the USA and Health Canada in Canada.
Monitors remotely review case report forms and possibly source documentation to complete the required source data verification.

The Report on Prior Investigations (ROPI) is analogous to an investigators brochure. The Investigator's Brochure (IB) is a comprehensive document summarizing the body of information about an investigational product ("IP" or "study drug") obtained during a drug trial.

A serious adverse event (SAE) in clinical trials is defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disabiliyt/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or requires intervention to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Sample size refers to the number of subjects required to be enrolled in a clinical trial in order to meet the primary objective.
Study Coordinator aka Clinical Research Coordinator

Secondary objectives are those whose completion, although desirable, will not directly impact the overall trial. These will often be posited to answer scientific questions about the disease state, to glean safety of efficacy data in sub populations etc..

"Selection criteria are those criteria outlined in the protocol which determine which patients are eligible for participation. These consist of the inclusion and the exclusion criteria. If a subject does not meet all of the inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria in the protocol he or she is not eligible to participate. These selection criteria are in place to ensure the safety of patients as well as the scientific integrity of the study "
A condition that is the consequence of a previous disease or injury.
A condition that is the consequence of a previous disease or injury (ie a scar)

A serious adverse event (SAE) in clinical trials is defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose
results in death, is life-threatening requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or requires intervention to prevent permanent impairment or damage
The process of a sponsor assessing whether or not a clinical trial site has the capacity and capabilities to successfully run their protocol.
A Standard operating procedure, or SOP, is a set of step-by-step instructions compiled by an organisation to help workers carry out routine operations.
Source data verification involves reviewing the data submitted on the case report forms to the data available at the site in the source documentation, and vice versa.

A source document is a document in which data collected for a clinical trial is first recorded. These data are usually later entered in the case report form. The ICH-GCP guidelines define source documents as original documents, data, and records.
A source document is a document in which data collected for a clinical trial is first recorded. These data are usually later entered in the case report form.
A source document is the original record containing the details to substantiate an interaction with a patient.
A sponsor is an individual, company, institution or organisation which takes responsibility for the initiation, management and/or financing of a clinical trial.
A Standard operating procedure, or SOP, is a set of step-by-step instructions compiled by an organisation to help workers carry out routine operations.

The subject enrollment log identifies subjects enrolled in the clinical trial. This log will enable identification of the subject in the source documents via the subjectâ€™s trial assigned identifier. This will also be used to track and follow a subject through their participation in the clinical trial.
Trial Master File. Compilation of all documents which individually and collectively permit the evaluation of the conduct of the study,
Clinical trial supplies includes such things as case report form binders, laboratory kits, equipment ( blood pressure monitor, ECG etc).
A process of establishing and documenting that the specified requirements of a computerized system can be consistently fulfilled.
